RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 7, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: J B GRAY broke sharp and was able to set the pace while being pressured by another foe, saved ground while racing along the rail, was un hurried through the turn and fell back, was asked at the sixteenth pole came back on late, battled with the leader in deep stretch and was victorious. SILKY'S DANCE settled off the early pace, was given time to find his stride while racing in the three path, was cued at the quarter pole where he responded with a nice turn of foot, came along the side of another competitor, battled with that one, took the lead, was challenged by another foe who slipped up the rail late, battled again for the win but came up short today. ROCK STAR ALEX laid just off the pace early, took the lead after the half mile pole from the three path, was challenged by another foe moving into the stretch, battled in the upper stretch and faded. SOUTH AL SPARKY was off slow, raced along the outside, was asked at the half mile pole, advanced into good striking position then faltered late.

ENTRY.NAME: South Al Sparky
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, 5w, asked 1/2, in contention 1-16, faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Silky's Dance
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, settled in hands, moved 1/4, took lead, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: J B Gray
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharp, set pace, rail, fell back, closed, battled late, up

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Adcock's Red River Farm, LLC & J. Adcock

ENTRY.NAME: Rock Star Alex
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked,3w, led 1/2, battled 1/4, faded late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 46. Maiden Claiming Purse 14000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CECE WAVE gunned for the early lead, smartly took back and settled into a stalking position, saved ground while racing along the rail waited patiently for the quarter pole where she waws asked and responded with a turn of foot, was able to move up the rail and draw off. SWEET LITTLE ROSE raced off the pace from mid pack in the eight path, was asked at the quarter pole, responded well, closed in the deep furlong ground, drifted out late but was able to hold on to second. SMILING ANGEL was off slow, was unhurried and settled off the pace from the nine path, was asked to start gaining ground after the half mile pole, responded and was kept to task around the turn and into the stretch while passing tired rivals at the quarter pole, kept the drive going but could not get up n time today. AFLEET CHARLENE was sent to the lead out of the gates, set the pace while racing along the fence, showed the way into the the furlong ground where she tired. CAT B CAUSE was off a bit slow, settled into the rear of the field early while racing seven wide, moved closer into contention at the three eights pole, was seven wide at the quarter pole and into the upper stretch, was encouraged and raced past rivals that were to the inside but was not enough. FIELD OF LIGHTS was mid pack six wide, settled in hands early, was edged out a bit at the three eighths pole made a mild bid, at the quarter pole and finished flat. BAILEY'S CHARM no factor. BISTINEAU BELLE never involved. BON CHANCE BET gunned for the lead out of the gates, settled off the pace in the three path, made a slight improvement by the three eighths pole, then stopped in the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Afleet Charlene
ENTRY.OWNER: Beene Linda D and Rowe Stephen
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent, set pace, rail, strongly encouraged early, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Bistineau Belle
ENTRY.COMMENT: never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Bailey's Charm
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Bon Chance Bet
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent , settled off the pace, in contention, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Cece Wave
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent, settled and stalked, saved ground, challenged 1/4, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Field of Lights
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, raced even

ENTRY.NAME: Cat B Cause
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Little Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 5w, raced in between early, moved 1/4, drifted stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Smiling Angel
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, 9w, one long run, closed 9 wide, stretch, up for third.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 16000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE NOVEMBER 7, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 7, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOLD MERRITT was sent to the lead early, happily set the fractions and maintained the pace while being pressured by an outside foe, showed the way into he furlong ground where he shook his rival and drew off. LAUGHINGSAINTSSONG was sent to the front and had the lead early on, was quickly challenged and relinquished the lead to another rival, stayed on top of that rival from a stalking position through the sixteenth pole then tired late but had done enough work early on to hold the place position. PERFECT PERIGEE broke sharp, was driven to try to take the lead, had to settled off the pace and stalk the early leaders from the four path, chased and closed in on the early leaders in the stretch but had to much ground to make up and had to settle for third. SUCH was racing mid pack early, drifted back along the backside while racing from the five path, was encouraged at the three eighths pole, advanced and passed rivals from the eight path into the stretch and finished well. CYPRIANO broke sharp settled off the pace from the rail position and raced even. MR. PRIORITY was off slow, raced off the pace from the four path, made slight steady gain into the turn shifted out to the nine path at the five sixteenths pole, made a mild bid into the stretch but had too much ground to make up. DONNA'S COURT was mid pack early, settled in hands off the pace, moved up at the three eighths pole, then tired at the sixteenth pole. YES BAB showed little. GRIEF was never involved. REECE'S PRIORITY broke sharp.

ENTRY.NAME: Cypriano
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharp, raced even from the rail

ENTRY.NAME: Gold Merritt
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, sent, took lead and set pace, was pressured, drew away

ENTRY.NAME: Donna's Court
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, between early, tired late

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Priority
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, mild gain

ENTRY.NAME: Such
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, settled in hands, closed late

ENTRY.NAME: Reece's Priority
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke well, backed up

ENTRY.NAME: Yes Bab
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Grief
ENTRY.COMMENT: was never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Laughingsaintssong
ENTRY.COMMENT: gunned early, stalked, faded late

ENTRY.NAME: Perfect Perigee
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharp, encouraged early, settled chased, up for third

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 91. Allowance Purse 30000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MAY 7, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 7, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HELAIRE broke on top, took the early lead along the inside in the two path, was joined by an outside rival, raced with this rival applying pressure from the outside for the first furlong, then matched strides from the half mile pole through the tun and into the stretch, battled on down to the last furlong where HELAIRE finally shook his rival and drew away for the win. INTO WISHING broke into a stalking position, pressured the early leader from the outside, drew along the side of the leaders by the half mile marker, matched strides through the turn, battled into the lane but gave way late. FAR BEYOND stalked the leaders from the three path, put in a mild bid at the quarter pole but was not enough. RUNNINGINTHEMONEY no factor. COHERE never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Helaire
ENTRY.OWNER: Roe Steve D and Roe Patricia L
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharp, set early pace,

ENTRY.NAME: Runninginthemoney
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Cohere
ENTRY.COMMENT: never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Into Wishing
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, pressured the leader, matched strides, battled ,upfor2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Far Beyond
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3-4w, not enough

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 18000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over On The Turf Since April 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SALUTE NOW stalked the early leader from the rail, moved up at the half briefly challenged for the lead, shook that competitor, drew away through the turn and held on for the win. DUDE DROP KID broke a bit slow, was urged into mid pack while being five wide, tucked in behind horses through the first turn well off the leaders, was kept after and encouraged to steadily close ground along the back side, was in contention at the three eighths pole, was kept to task into the stretch, continued to close in on the early leader but ran out of room and settled for second. WESTERN STAR stalked the early pace while being settled in hands from the two path, was gently urged to close ground at the half mile marker, continued pushing forward through the turn safely held off the rest of the filed while maintaining third. PUTTHEHAMMERDOWN took back early, settled in hands along the rail, moved up into the middle of the field by the half mile marker but made no improvement. AMAVI was well off the pace early on, took a ground saving trip until the three eighths pole, edged further out by the five sixteenth pole, continued to close passing tired rivals. YOU YOUR DADDY SON set the early pace, was challenged for the lead at the half mile marker, chased after the leader and faded. KINGPRIN was no factor. MR. BUTCH WOMBLE was forwardly placed early, was asked to advance at the three eighths pole to no avail.

ENTRY.NAME: Salute Now
ENTRY.OWNER: Cascio Andrew J and D and F Horse Farms
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, rail, took control at the 1/2, drew off

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Andrew J. Cascio & D & F Horse Farms LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Putthehammerdown
ENTRY.COMMENT: took back start, settled in hands rail, chased,

ENTRY.NAME: You Your Daddy Son
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent, set pace, challenged, caught, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Western Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2w, advanced rail 1/2, urged through turn, up for place

ENTRY.NAME: Kingprin
ENTRY.COMMENT: was no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Butch Womble
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed early, asked 3/8, no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Dude Drop Kid
ENTRY.OWNER: Charles C. and John Dirik, LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke slow, chased 5w, steadily gained ground, 5wupper,

ENTRY.NAME: Amavi
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, saved ground,8w upper, passed tired rivals

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 49. Maiden Claiming Purse 10000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BELL PEPPER settled off the pace along the rail early, stalked through the backside and into the turn, tucked behind the leader leaving the turn, after the quarter pole, slipped down to the rail and was able to pass the early leader undetected and drew away. BROADWAY PEARL broke a bit slow, raced mid pack from the four path, angled out at the half mile marker, circled the field with a nice turn of foot while being seven wide, entered the upper stretch nine wide continued to close and gain ground with every stride was within striking distance but was challenged by a horse along the rail and did not have enough today. VALENTINE ANGEL vied for the lead and set the pace, attended the pace from the two and three path uncontested until the five sixteenth pole, was collared by a challenger and battled for a few strides and tired in the lane. CORONA DEL MAR showed early speed and was right off of the early leader while racing in the three path, stayed on in the top flight through the turn and to the quarter pole, had trouble switching leads and tired in the lane. CHATAIN'S EAGLE broke slow and was allowed to settle off the pace while finding her stride, raced eight wide early, was asked to move at the half mile pole where she responded well passing horses from the three and four path in the turn, edged out at the quarter pole into the upper stretch, where she was driven and encouraged and continued to make head way down the lane but it was not enough today . MILU ROCKET settled into the second flight just behind the early leaders while racing from the four path, advanced at the three eighths pole continued to hold that position until the sixteenth pole and tired. DON'T BLINK TWICE sowed good early speed but then dropped back to last early on, raced in the four path the whole trip and was able to pass tired rivals at the quarter pole. SENSING GOLD showed early speed while racing from the five path, angled into the three path while being driven to stay with the early leaders, was being encouraged through the turn to continue on with the leaders while trying to get out, was wide upper stretch and failed to switch leads then tired. COURT COSTS flashed early speed from the outside and fell back. SEE YA BYE was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Bell Pepper
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off pace, stalked, closed 1/4, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: See Ya Bye
ENTRY.COMMENT: was never a factor

ENTRY.NAME: Don't Blink Twice
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed early speed, dropped back to last 4w, passed tired rivals

ENTRY.NAME: Valentine Angel
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for the lead, 2-3w, set pace, collared 1/4, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Broadway Pearl
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, off pace, edged out 1/2, raced 6-8w, upper, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Corona Del Mar
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed speed, races with the early leader, 3w, tired stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Milu Rocket
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2nd flight, stalked 4w, btwn, chased at the 1/4

ENTRY.NAME: Sensing Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed, 5w, asked to stay in top flight, failed to switch, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Court Costs
ENTRY.COMMENT: flashedsapeed, fell back

ENTRY.NAME: Chatain's Eagle
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, settled off pace 8w, asked 1/2, gained ground 4w, close

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 80. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 31000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IRONIT set the early pace while being challenged by another rival on the inside and stalked buy another rival on the outside, stayed on through the turn and into the stretch where IRONIIT was able to finally shake the inside rival but still had to battle with the outside challenger until deep into the furlong ground, was kept to task and was able to out finish the out side challenger and was up for the win. OURPERFECTPRINCESS rated just off the leaders hip from the four path, stayed on with the early leaders until the seven sixteenth pole, challenged, battled through the stretch, settled for second while racing a game race. REBECCA G vied for the lead from the rail, stayed in company with the eventual winner through out most of the race while saving ground, challenged for the lead and gave way. L G GIRL never involved. THEBOYZGALAXY not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Rebecca G
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, matched strides, rail, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Theboyzgalaxy
ENTRY.COMMENT: not a factor

ENTRY.NAME: Ironit
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, challenged, maintained lead, drew off

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: David N. Meche & Perry J. Judice

ENTRY.NAME: L G Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Ourperfectprincess
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, challenged, game 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 8 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 18000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 7, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $17,500, if for $15,000, allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by managemen t to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at one mile and seventy yards) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MONARCH'S MISCHIEF settled into the second tier in the three and four path, rated until the half mile marker, edged out and advanced while being challenged by an outside attacker, continued to gain ground through the turn and challenged for the lead at the five sixteenth pole, took command by the quarter pole and drew clear. WHITAKER was off slow and allowed to settle in hands while finding his stride, maintained position until the half mile marker, started to advance and gained ground at the three eighths pole still from the four path, spilt horses through the turn, angled out at the quarter pole, was set down for the drive and was kept to ask while closing beautifully, but could not catch the leader but ran a game second. CREME DE BALI vied for the lead, matched strides with the early leader by the six furlong pole from the three path, continued on in company setting the pace through the three eighths pole, was challenged by an outside foe battled with that foe until deep in the furlong ground and tired late. ELUSIVE D'ORO raced along the rail from mid pack, had a ground saving trip and maintained momentum and position but to no avail. DECLARE WAR raced mid pack early along the rail was allowed to fall back to last, was asked to make one run while saving ground and passed tired rivals in the stretch. PAYNTED LOVER made no impact. MOUNTAIN BREEZE raced from the four and five path, was asked at the half mile marker, circled the field at the three eighths while being six wide and tired at the quarter pole. HELIOCHROME was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Heliochrome
ENTRY.COMMENT: was never a factor

ENTRY.NAME: Declare War
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, dropped back, rail trip, passed tired rivals

ENTRY.NAME: Whitaker
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, settled in hands, 4w, moved 3/8, gained, split,6wupper

ENTRY.NAME: Paynted Lover
ENTRY.COMMENT: made no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Elusive d'Oro
ENTRY.COMMENT: raced mid pack, saved ground, maintained position, no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Monarch's Mischief
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off the pace, moved at the 1/2 4w, challenge1/4, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Creme de Bali
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, matched 6f, led 3/8, challenged battled tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Mountain Breeze
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-5w, mid pack early, moved 1/2, circled filed, tired 1/4
